title: Big Trade Deal Between Europe and South America
summary: The European Union and a group of South American countries called Mercosur signed a big trade agreement. This deal took over 25 years to make and helps them trade more easily by removing most taxes on goods. It makes shopping cheaper for over 700 million people in Europe and South America. The signing happened in Asunción, Paraguay. Leaders like Ursula von der Leyen from Europe and Lula da Silva from Brazil said it promotes fair trade and cooperation instead of fighting over tariffs. The deal is important because it shows countries working together even when others like the U.S. are raising tariffs. Mercosur includes Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay, and Uruguay, with Bolivia able to join later. This agreement creates one of the world's largest free trade zones.

background_read: This article is about a trade deal between Europe and South America. Trade agreements help countries buy and sell goods without extra costs. The European Union is a group of European countries, and Mercosur is a group of South American countries. They signed this deal to work together and make things cheaper for people. It shows how countries can cooperate instead of fighting over trade.
Article_Structure: WHO: European Union and Mercosur (Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay, Uruguay)
WHAT: Signed a free trade agreement to remove tariffs and create a large trade zone
WHY: To strengthen commercial ties, make shopping cheaper, and promote fair trade over tariffs
